name: ItemHelper
description: ItemHelper is a comprehensive helper class that provides access to Minecraft item properties and behaviors.
overview: It represents an item type (not a specific item stack) and allows you to query various attributes like enchantability, durability, food properties, and tool capabilities. Category: Items and Enchantments. You typically obtain an `ItemHelper` instance from: An `ItemStackHelper` using `.getItem()`, Registry lookups using item IDs, Various inventory and crafting contexts.

methods.name: getCreativeTab
methods.description: Gets all creative inventory tabs/groups where this item can be found

methods.name: getGroupIcon
methods.description: Gets the display item stacks for the creative tabs this item belongs to

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Gets the display name of the item translated to the current language
examples:
const itemName = item.getName();
log("Item name: " + itemName); // e.g., "Diamond Sword"

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Gets the unique resource location identifier for this item
examples:
const itemId = item.getId();
log("Item ID: " + itemId); // e.g., "minecraft:diamond_sword"

methods.name: getMaxCount
methods.description: Gets the maximum number of items that can be stacked together
examples:
const maxStack = item.getMaxCount();
log("Can stack up to: " + maxStack + " items"); // Usually 64 or 16

methods.name: getMaxDurability
methods.description: Gets how much damage the item can take before breaking. Returns 0 for non-damageable items.

methods.name: isDamageable
methods.description: Checks if this item has durability and can be damaged

methods.name: isFireproof
methods.description: Checks if the item will survive in fire or lava

methods.name: canBeNested
methods.description: Checks if this item can be nested inside other containers

methods.name: isTool
methods.description: Checks if this item is a tool (pickaxe, axe, shovel, hoe, etc.)

methods.name: isWearable
methods.description: Checks if this item is armor that can be equipped

methods.name: getEnchantability
methods.description: Gets the enchantability factor. Higher values mean better enchantments are more likely.

methods.name: getMiningSpeedMultiplier
methods.description: Gets how fast this item can mine the specified block type

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Block state to check mining speed against

methods.name: isSuitableFor
methods.description: Checks if this item is suitable for mining the given block (will cause drops)

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: Block to check mining suitability against

methods.name: isSuitableFor
methods.description: Checks if this item is suitable for mining the given block (will cause drops)

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: Block state to check mining suitability against

methods.name: canBeRepairedWith
methods.description: Checks if the given item stack can be used as repair material

methods.name: isFood
methods.description: Checks if this item can be eaten by the player

methods.name: getFood
methods.description: Gets detailed food component information if this item is edible

methods.name: isBlockItem
methods.description: Checks if this item is a block that can be placed

methods.name: getBlock
methods.description: Gets the block representation of this item

methods.name: hasRecipeRemainder
methods.description: Checks if crafting with this item leaves a different item behind (like buckets)

methods.name: getRecipeRemainder
methods.description: Gets the item that remains after using this item in crafting

methods.name: getDefaultStack
methods.description: Creates a new item stack of this type with default properties
examples:
const newStack = item.getDefaultStack();
log("Created stack with: " + newStack.getCount() + " items");

methods.name: getStackWithNbt
methods.description: Creates an item stack with custom NBT data. Throws: `CommandSyntaxException` if the NBT data is invalid

parameters.name: nbt
parameters.description: NBT data string to apply to the stack
